overview:
Shahriar Karim is a principal technologist at Nokia corporation. He has had various roles in the Telecomms domain for the past 15 years. In his current role at Nokia Mr. Karim concentrates on Strategy, Architecture, and technical governance of the Ovi set of services. At Motorola he was the driver behind the GAMA platform, leading it through initial concept, Systems Architecture, and strategy phases, among other things.

Mr. Karim has also been involved for over 10 years in web standardization bodies, having chaired working groups at the Open mobile Alliance, and held technical lead roles at W3C and various other bodies.

Mr. Karim holds a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering from the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, and a Masters in Electrical Engineering from the Illinois Institute of Technology.
